subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] How do you tell?
author: Zack Widup
full_text:
If you read back in some of the earliest messages on the group, you'll find
out that Frank built his boxes with a totally different purpose than
receiving communications from "ghosts." It appears the entities who have
been communicating through Frank's boxes are NOT ghosts at all. They are
something else. I guess "spirit technicians" seems to describe them best. We
still don't know who or where they are or what their purpose is. But they're
there somewhere, apparently.

Zack

> find what most want to use the boxes for, ghost hunting and demon chasing
> very discouraging. I don't know of anyone that uses this stuff, be it hack
> boxes, or any other method to try to actually get higher level contacts. No
> one just allows the entities to speak, all want to second guess something
> that has more access and is in a higher state of being. Everyone wants to be
> TAPS, and get the crap scared out themselves. Most hear only what they want
> to hear. I don't know what the answer is.
>
>  F-S

>
>>
>>
>>   Frank,
>> Do you personally make boxes for purchase?
>>
>> Teddy
>>
>> --- On *Mon, 8/30/10, Frank Sumption <purplealiengirl@...>* wrote:
>>
>>
>> From: Frank Sumption <purplealiengirl@...>
>> Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] How do you tell?
>> To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
>> Date: Monday, August 30, 2010, 1:56 AM
>>
>>
>>
>>
>>  Well, "the box" in nothing more than a radio with swept tuning--as far as
>> I know and have experienced, sweep across the radios tuning range, or band
>> generates bits of speech music and noise that the entities use to reform
>> into their voices, although there maybe more involved, but I don't know how
>> one would test it.
>>
>>  Most of the boxes for sale out there are the hack radio boxes. Many of
>> the modern digital radios have a function that mutes, or quiets the radio
>> while tuning between stations. I'm not sure why, but unmutting the radio
>> allows the audio to be heard while the radio searches for the next
>> station--and--the radio is disallowed form locking onto a station, so it
>> keeps sweeping all the way to the end of the band--AM or FM, then starts
>> over. This creates the raw audio and "they" speak. The sweep can even be
>> done by hand, tuning a radio slowing by hand. I sue cheap radios I get at
>> thrift stores for this, gluing a dowel to the tuning knob to make it easier.
>> Then record form the speaker--open air.
>>
>>  So as long as the radio sweeps at not to fast and not too slow, it'll
>> works. Some are better than others.
>>
>>  It takes some practice, and maybe even a certain allowing to hear the
>> ghost voices.
>>
>>  I prefer to take a tuner out of a radio, such as a clock radio and supply
>> an external sweep voltage. The sweep circuits are just basic op amps, and
>> you can buy a function generator kit to supply a triangle wave for linear
>> sweep. See keyportparanormal.com for more info on using this kit, and
>> building boxes.
>>
>>  One problem with this stuff is that it can be extremely subjective,
>> others may not hear what you hear, or hear it the same. I think mostly the
>> messages are meant for the one that receives it. We go round and round with
>> the skeptics and debunkers.
>>
>>  F-S
>> On Sun, Aug 29, 2010 at 11:08 PM, usmcmacswife <usmcmacswife@...<http://mc/compose?to=usmcmacswife@...>
>> > wrote:
>>
>>
>>
>> Ok, we're new here hello!
>>
>> We just had a couple questions. HOW do you tell if you're being ripped off
>> if you are searching online to buy a box? If you can point us in the right
>> direction of where to purchase a "frank's box" would be deeply appreciated.
>> We saw that you can try and make your own but with my husband's work
>> schedule and mine with 4 kids, sports etc.. the only time we get to work
>> with EVP's and such is when we schedule an investigation and secure a
>> babysitter! LOL Not to mention my husband isn't that technologically
>> inclined. That is my job... and I would be afraid that I'd have done
>> something incorrectly and what we were experiencing really wasn't "true".
>> Sorry to sound like such a newbie I'm sure!
>>
>> Thank you! Teddy
>>
>>
>>
>>
